   Summary: Sweet potato feathery mottle virus (SPFMV) and Sweet potato chlorotic stunt virus (SPCSV) are the most common viruses infecting sweetpotato in Uganda.

messages.name: web_search

messages.content:
The 2016 Uganda (Pearl of Africa) paper on SPFMV and SPCSV used ELISA for virus testing, whose most common enzyme labels are alkaline phosphatase and horseradish peroxidase; their EC numbers are 3.1.3.1 and 1.11.1.7, respectively, ordered alphabetically by chemical name.

FINAL ANSWER: 3.1.3.1;1.11.1.7
